conditions.name: Admission Rescheduling Condition
conditions.description: Condition for proceeding with admission to the CRU on Day 1.
conditions.text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Hypoglycemia Induction Endpoint
conditions.description: Criteria for stopping the insulin infusion.
conditions.text: Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL.

conditions.name: Safety Review Gate
conditions.description: Condition for continuing enrollment after the first cohort.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2, and the remaining patients will be dosed after confirmation of the safety.

conditions.name: TE ADA Positive Status
conditions.description: Condition for entering the additional follow-up period.
conditions.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

conditions.name: Non-inferiority Declaration Criteria
conditions.description: Statistical condition for declaring the primary objective met.
conditions.text: Non-inferiority of LY900018 will be declared if the upper limit of the 2-sided 95% CI constructed on the difference in percentage (IMG - LY900018) is less than the NIM of 10%.

transitionRules.name: Screen to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Patients who meet all eligibility criteria during the screening period will be enrolled and randomized to a treatment sequence.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

transitionRules.name: Patient Replacement Rule
transitionRules.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced. Replacement should not occur beyond 75 patients enrolled.

transitionRules.name: Continuation of Inadvertently Enrolled Patients
transitionRules.text: If a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria was inadvertently enrolled, a discussion must occur between the Lilly CP/CRP and the investigator to determine if the patient may continue in the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation due to Other Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Discontinuation for enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or other incompatible medical research.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Decision to Discontinue
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason, including an AE, SAE, or a severe hypoglycemia event.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Patient Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Discontinuation for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits, including the follow-up visit 26 to 30 days after the last study treatment.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Admission Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 1 of each treatment period to proceed with or reschedule admission based on plasma glucose levels.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Study Drug Administration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to stop insulin infusion and administer study drug based on achieving the target low plasma glucose level.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Study Continuation Safety Gate
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point after the first 6 patients complete Period 2 to determine if the study can continue dosing the remaining patients.
